title: Church of Bones bans photos after visitors take inappropriate snaps with skeletons
text:

The Sedlec Ossuary in the Czech Republic has announced it plans to ban visitors from taking photos inside after too many visitors taking inappropriate pictures.

Nicknamed the 'Church of Bones, the landmark in the city of Kutná Hora has over 60,000 skulls and skeletons on its walls and ceilings.

However, Church authorities told local media that they have had enough of visitors who are taking selfies with the skulls or trying to get a picture for social media.

In fact, they say some visitors go as far as touching the skeletons and taking bones off the walls to move them into specific poses purely for a photo.

The skulls and skeletons are very real, so locals argue that it's disrespectful to the deceased, not to mention it shows a lack of respect for the landmark's historical and religious significance.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

Although signs were put up to remind guests to show respect, many tourists have ignored the warnings and continued to move the bones, or even put accessories on them before taking a snap.

As a result, authorities have decided to move forward with a ban on photography.

(Image: Getty)

The only exception will be made for visitors who request permission from the authorities at least three days in advance of their visit, and are granted the right to take snaps. (Filming at the site will require permission to be requested at least three weeks in advance).

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

The same restrictions will also apply to visitors who explore the nearby Church of the Assumption of Our Lady and Saint John the Baptist, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

It's not exactly clear when the new restrictions will come into place but it's likely to be imminently.

(Image: Getty)

The ossuary, which dates back to the 14th century, is currently undergoing major renovations but it remains open to tourists.

It's estimated that nearly half a million visitors pass through the landmark and cathedral every year.
description: The Church of Bones has over 60,000 skulls and skeletons but some visitors move them to take selfies
